Yes. Maybe I mean just EJBs. At the very least, 90% or more of the J2EE hac=
ks are EJB hacks.

It turns out that programmers WANT to call save().

So s=
aid Chappell, Simon P on 4/4/2003 --------------------
I agree with much of=
 what you say.

I would like to differentiate between J2EE and EJB's, which=
 I think is what you are really refering to. EJB's are an as yet immature t=
echnology, in much the same way that JSP was when it first came out. Given =
a few more years and much cogitation, I'm sure that they can be fixed or re=
placed with something better.

I saw in a recent report on the SD conferenc=
e that Scott Ambler led a panel discussion where the entire panel (includin=
g a Sun engineer) expressed disappointment with Entity EJB's.

I remember b=
eing really excited when I first heard of EJBs, but the more I try to learn=
 about them, the more I find myself shying away from them.

Simon
